contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Weapon | name=VBC-90 | image=[[File:VBC-90 mg 7761.jpg|300px|]] | caption= |origin={{flag|France}} |type=Armoured car |is_vehicle=yes |is_UK=yes | used_by =France, Oman | manufacturer =[[Renault|Renault Véhicules Industriels]]/[[Creusot-Loire]] | spec_label =<ref name="JAAA87 p179-1">Foss 1987, pp. 179–181.</ref> | length={{convert|5.63|m|ftin|abbr=on}}<br>{{convert|8.135|m|ftin|abbr=on}} (gun forward) | width={{convert|2.50|m|ftin|abbr=on}} | height={{convert|2.552|m|ftin|abbr=on}} | weight={{convert|13500|kg|lb}} | suspension=6x6 wheel | speed={{convert|92|km/h|mph|abbr=on}} | vehicle_range={{convert|1000|km|mi|abbr=on}} | primary_armament=90 mm gun | secondary_armament=7.62 mm machine gun | armour= | engine=Renault MIDS 06.20.45 6 cylinder water-cooler diesel engine | engine_power={{convert|220|hp|kW||disp=flip}} | pw_ratio=16 hp/tonne | crew=3 }} The '''VBC-90''' (Véhicule Blindé de Combat - armoured combat vehicle) is a 6x6 [[Armored car (military)|armoured car]] equipped with a 90 mm high velocity gun in a GIAT TS 90 rotating turret. It equips the armoured squadron of the [[Mobile Gendarmerie]], with 32 units built. ==Design== The VBC-90 was developed by Renault Véhicules Industriels based on Renault's [[Véhicule de l'Avant Blindé]] (VAB) wheeled [[armoured personnel carrier]], which had been built in large numbers for the [[French army]]. Unlike the VAB, it was not designed to meet an official requirement, being intended to meet export requirements.<ref name="JAAA87 p179-1"/> It has a steel hull armoured to protect against [[small arms]] fire. It has a crew of three, with the driver sitting at the front of the vehicle with three bullet-proof windows provided for the driver. A GIAT TS 90 turret carries the commander and gunner, and carries an armament of a 90 mm cannon with a [[Co-axial_machine_gun#Coaxial|co-axial]] 7.62 mm machine gun. 20 rounds of 90 mm ammunition are carried in the turret, with a further 25 rounds in the hull.<ref name="JAAA87 p179-1"/> It is powered by a six-cylinder [[diesel engine]] mounted at the rear of the hull, driving a [[Six-wheel drive|6x6 drive]]. The vehicle is not [[Amphibious vehicle|amphibious]], unlike the VAB on which it was based.<ref name="JAAA87 p179-1"/> ==History== The first prototype VBC-90 was completed in 1979.<ref name="recog p373">Foss 2002, p. 373.</ref> The French [[National Gendarmerie]] placed an order for 28 VBC-90s, with deliveries starting in 1983. A further six VBC-90s were purchased by [[Oman]],<ref name="JAAA87 p179-1"/> but no further production followed.<ref name="recog p373"/> <gallery> File:VBC-90 img 2322.jpg File:VBC-90 img 2376.jpg </gallery> ==References== {{reflist}} *Foss, Christopher F.
